==Japanese==
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|族長|族長: the Biblical Patriarchs}}
{{ja-kanjitab|族|長}}
{{wikipedia|Patriarch}}

===Etymology===
From {{etyl|zhx|ja|sort=ぞくちょう}} {{m|zh|族長}}.

===Pronunciation===
* [[音読み|On'yomi]]
* {{IPA|lang=ja|/zo.ku.t͡ɕo.o/|[zo̞kɯᵝt͡ɕʲo̞ː]}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|ぞくちょう}}

# the [[head]] of a [[family]] or [[clan]]
# a [[patriarch]] of ancient [[Israel]], as described in the [[Bible]]

====Usage notes====
Historically, this role has more commonly been filled by a man. However, this word alone is generally not [[gender]]-[[specific]], and can refer to either a male or female head of a family. To specify a particular gender, this word may be prefixed with either {{m|ja|女|tr=onna||woman}} or {{m|ja|男|tr=otoko||man}}.

====Synonyms====
* {{sense|head of a family}} {{ja-r|家長|かちょう}}

====Derived terms====
* {{ja-r|族長時代|^ぞくちょう ^じだい}}: the [[w:Patriarchal age|Patriarchal Age]], as described in the [[Bible]]

====See also====
* {{ja-r|女族長|おんな ぞくちょう}}: a [[matriarch]], a [[female]] head of a family or clan
* {{ja-r|男族長|おとこ ぞくちょう}}: a [[patriarch]], a [[male]] head of a family or clan
* {{ja-r|女家長|おんな かちょう}}: a [[matriarch]], a [[female]] head of a [[house]] or [[household]]
* {{ja-r|男家長|おとこ かちょう}}: a [[patriarch]], a [[male]] head of a [[house]] or [[household]]
